Posts.Content: Carly68 wrote: Hello I joined this web-site months ago because my mom was diagnosed with breast cancer and had a mastectomy and just as she was healing from that she got sick with what they called a viral infection but they dont know what so she was in the hospital for 8 days and is now recovering in a Rehab center till she is strong enough to come home and than deal with her breast cancer. MEANWHILE  2 weeks ago i was reaching for something and my right breast hurt,,,,,to make a story short I just got my pathalogy report and i have breast cancer also ....What are the chances of with in 3 months mother and daughter are diagnosed. My stats are different than hers (sort of) i have and i quote invasive ductal carcinoma  ,,poorly differentiated grade 3 with prominent lymphocytic infiltrate <--What? measuring at least 0.6 cm extensive tumor necrosis >1 HPF ductal carcinoma in situ,cribriform type (high nuclear grade)is present. HER2 not yet done Now this language is totally different from my mom except for the Invasive ductal carcinoma part..........If any one can make heads or tales from my report feel free to post.....I cant beleive this I am only 39 and I have no idea if I should follow my moms route or what. One more thing on the report is says invasive than In SITU is that not contradicting?? Dx 2/5/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, 0/12 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Carly68 wrote: My mom has been asked to go back for more pictures and a ultrasound ,,all I got from the nurse was they want to look more closely to the left breast with this info I did a breast exam on my mom (75 yrs old) and I can feel under her left breat a lump and it hurts her when I push gently into it.....Its to late to tell me not to worry (thats allready happen) My question is breast cancer lumps usually pain full ,,,she is having no other symtoms and the one place is the only place she feels pain,,,,even she was unaware of the pain untill I pushed on the lump and I did not apply alot of presure.  No nipple discharge (that she aware of ).........Her appoinments are not untill next week but it feels like forever.  I did find it strange that the x-ray dept contact us 3 days after her mammagram this was quick and the booked her appoinment 1 week later for the follow up pictures.....I f you knew my town you would understand this city takes forever to get medical care. But in her case they seem to be moving quickly Dx 2/5/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, 0/12 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
